1097549087979626497.text:
I’m curious how other distributed teams encourage unprompted brainstorming and idea sharing.

Reply with your shower thoughts.

1097548134735998976.text:
This framing helps elicit thought and inspires a willingness to give and take healthy criticism.

It also allows the CEO and team leads to share half-baked ideas without sounding like a top-down command to prioritize.

1097547679935033354.text: At Product Hunt we try to create a culture of sharing ideas by using the phrases “wild idea” or “shower thought”.pic.twitter.com/rCjuiSkYOr

1097547169299492865.text: But in Slack, its permanence in writing can dissuade some people from sharing especially when unprompted.

1097546935781617670.text:
Unstructured collaboration is challenging for remote teams.

In person it’s easier to throw out ideas and brainstorm freely over lunch, in the hallway, etc. The ephemerality of IRL conversation lowers the barrier to sharing and is more conducive to serendipity.
